sentences.text: [serious] what is a “seems to be harmless” symptom that requires an immediate trip to the er?
this might not be “immediate trip to the er,” but it certainly is “immediately make a doctor’s appointment asap.”.
if it doesn't recover within a few hours, get yourself to er immediately.
if you've been strangled always go to the er after.
i went months without going to the er because i thought i was being dramatic.
about 9 months later she complained of a severe headache and declined my offer to take her to the er.
i figured i needed antibiotics, so i made an appointment with my doctor.
they freaked out saying i needed to go to the emergency room immediately.
i figured it could be an infection, but there was no pain or discomfort so i figured it would heal.
still no pain or discomfort.

sentences.text: serious replies only.
r4dioc4mbodia.
superficial burns to the face typically from bbq or stove lighting accidents.
it may seem like just some singed eyebrows, but if you were inhaling at all when the accident happened you could have burned the inside of your throat.
i was very surprised what happened next since i imagine people in urgent care see all sorts of bad stuff.
i went to urgent care and the nurse practitioner didn’t seem too worried.
when talking to my mom, who is a nurse, on the phone she said it’s serious and if i can’t see the doctor that same day then i need to go to urgent care.
but i went early enough to still be alive.
my mom had 3 strokes this way.
when i said yes, they said they’d call the hospital and give them my info and let them know i’m coming.

sentences.text: most people present with normal breathing, but as the injured tissues swell, it can close the airway.
one pupil is dilated while the other is normal.
i know two people who had no other symptoms besides the streaks both were admitted for sepsis and in hospital for a while.
most of these people feel fine directly following the accident and end up intubated if they make it to the hospital.
apparently it was so serious because once the infection passes a certain threshold, people go from feeling fine like i did to deathly ill in minutes.
then, between work and their wife, the people around them pieced together that they could no longer read at the same level.
apparently a stroke is not always accompanied by the other well known symptoms.
the following morning she didn't know who i was or recognize her own house.
red streaks near a wound, particularly on the limbs, can indicate a spreading infection and may be an early sign of sepsis.
sepsis is no joke.

sentences.text: i got a small cut, little more than a scratch, on my arm cleaning under a conveyor at work.
their work performance suffered.
i had a friend who fell out of a chair at a work party and hit their head hard on the ground.
hit your head hard?
my sister died from a antibiotic resistant blood infection back in 2021. she got a slight sunburn on her lip that got infected and was dead 2 weeks later.
i didn’t give it a good soap and water scrub until i got home several hours later.
a few days later i had a dark red bump with what looked like a pimple on it where the scratch had been.
then i rolled my sleeve all the way up and they saw red streaks going from the infected area up towards my arm pit.
it was going to be a few days.
they said i may have to stay for a couple days on iv antibiotics because i had sepsis, an infection spreading through my blood stream.

sentences.text: the sort of thing one barely notices.
it was black with coal dust, so i rinsed it off.
after a few days of it remaining the same, it suddenly grew larger and nastier looking.
also for those that are biologically female, losing your period or prolonged amenorrhea is oftentimes a sign of something larger going on thats attributed by doctors as stress.

if you notice a red spot on one breast that isn’t going away, if you have new orange-peel-like dimpling on one breast, or one breast appears swollen, any of those can be a sign of inflammatory breast cancer.
that’s a particularly aggressive form of breast cancer that’s usually only found in more advanced stages.
you usually don’t have a lump.
make sure to clean any cuts well right away.
i... should not have read all of these right before bedtime.
before i was admitted to the icu for 2 weeks i had muscle tetany (felt like pins/needles) in my feet, arms, chest and weirdly enough what felt like my nose for weeks.
